Detailed Description

Listener for setting events. The abstract functions are the callback functions that is called for the respective asynchronous function call in SettingsInterface.

Create a subclass and implement the callbacks and add a subclass object to the SettingsFavouriteInterface to start getting settingfavourite callbacks.

The error function, declared in the super class Listener, will be called for all requests that returns with an error.

Member Function Documentation

virtual void WFAPI::SettingsListener::eulaAvailable ( bool  updated,
WFString  filename 
) [pure virtual]

Called when a check against the server for a new EULA has been done.

Parameters:
updated True when a new unseen EULA is available, false if EULA available is the same as before the check against the server.
filename The filename of the EULA.

virtual void WFAPI::SettingsListener::newVersionAvailable ( const WFString &  versionNumber,
const WFString &  versionUrl,
const WFString &  versionString,
bool  force 
) [pure virtual]

Called when a new version is available to download. There is no request for this callback it will just get called when the there is a new version available of this client.

Parameters:
versionNumber The new version number. Comes as a string containing 3 different versions: <Program version>=""> : <Resource version>=""> : <MLFW version>=""> where the "Resource version" and "MLFW version" are optional. The program and resource versions are specified as: [1-9][0-9]*'.'[1-9][0-9]*'.'[1-9][0-9]* and the MLFW version is specified as a single number.
versionUrl The url where the new version is available for download.
versionString A freetext string for the new version. Can be an URI, a platform market link, a package name, an id, etc.
force A flag saying if the update should be forced, e.g. the user should not be able to use the application until he has accepted the upgrade.
